content: amber paul - sugar shack crafts 10 rounds flying disc stitch key ● chain = chain stitch ● single_crochet = single_crochet ● slip_stitch = slip_stitch ● st s = stitch es ● increase = increase ● decrease = decrease notes ● you can run a skein of worsted weight yarn through youri-cord machine or make it by hand by either crocheting or knitting it ● worsted weight yarn is held 3 strands together as you work ● rounds after the initial chain ring are not materials joined they are worked in continuous rounds use a stitch marker to mark the ● worsted weight yarn - colors your choice first stitch of each round for easier ● hook us k/ 6 5 mm tracking ● yarn needle scissors measuring tape and stitch marker ● premade i-cord or i-cord machine and worsted weight yarn gauge ● tip to tip at round 3 = 3 inches sizes ● recommended minimum size of disc 7-8 diameter amber paul| sugar shack crafts | 10 rounds flying disc 1 instructions round 9 single_crochet around while encasing holding 3 strands of worsted weight i-cord as you go together chain 8 and slip_stitch to form a ring work over your tail to minimize weaving ends round 1 place 12 single_crochet in ring 12 sts round 2 increase around 24 sts round 3 *single_crochet 3 increase* around measures 3 tip to tip 30 sts round 4 *single_crochet 4 increase* around 36 sts round 10 *single_crochet 4 decrease* around round 5 *single_crochet 5 increase* around 42 sts round 6 *single_crochet 6 increase* around finishing measures 6 tip to tip 48 sts ● cut a long tail from your 3 held yarns and use that to cover and secure the bits of round 7 *single_crochet 7 increase* around 6 5 54 i-cord start/end that may peek out giving sts it a bit of a stretch to pull it beneath the round 8 *single_crochet 8 increase* around measures single_crochet also can help 8 tip to tip 60 sts finish weaving in all ends amber paul| sugar shack crafts | 10 rounds flying disc 2
